definition: abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]

sentences.english: The only thing one can write that is a bit serious—a love letter.
sentences.chinese: 唯一我們能夠寫的就是一板正經的情書。

sentences.english: Write her a short love letter.
For these letters, Yan Shu never really seen.
sentences.chinese: 對於這些情書，顏姝從沒正眼看過。

sentences.english: He burned up all her love letters.
sentences.chinese: 他燒掉了所有她的情書。

sentences.english: The ‘letter’ has been changed as it is no longer a people's heart and a simple love letter.
sentences.chinese: 大概信不再言心，不再是表白真心的情書了才改的。

sentences.english: In fact, the most tear is a love letter chats.
sentences.chinese: 其實最催淚的情書是聊天記錄。

sentences.english: McAdams describes as "a love letter" to the City of Light.
sentences.chinese: 麥克亞當斯形容爲“情書”的城市之光。

sentences.english: So why not write each other love letters.
sentences.chinese: 所以爲什麼不去嘗試給對方寫封情書呢？

sentences.english: Paul the apostle understands the impact of writing love letters to churches in Philippi, Corinth, e.t.c.
sentences.chinese: 保羅明白寫情書到菲裏普教堂的影響。

sentences.english: Rereading it has no intention of the love letters, long time gradually old youth.
sentences.chinese: 無意重讀那年的情書，時光悠悠青春漸老。

sentences.english: I've spent my life fooling myself. Every letter I've ever written to you has been a love letter.
sentences.chinese: 我寫給你的每封信都是情書除了情書還能是什麼？

sentences.english: I've spent my life fooling myself. Every letter I've ever written to you has been a love letter.
sentences.chinese: 我寫給你的每封信都是情書除了情書還能是什麼？

sentences.english: Most of all, remember that it's private.
sentences.chinese: 最重要的是，記住，情書是私信。

sentences.english: Here is Madonna's love letter … to hydrangeas.
sentences.chinese: 這就是麥當娜寫給繡球花的情書。

sentences.english: Here nice book about Love Poems & Love Letters for your references.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有關於愛情詩及情書的好書可爲你參考。

sentences.english: Make sure your personal love letter gets your wife’s attention.
sentences.chinese: 確保你的個人情書能引起妻子的關注。

definition: in love with/to feel deeply attached to
to send/to give as a present
Leslie Cheung (1956-2003), Hong Kong singer and actor
to dismantle/to disassemble/to open up (sth sealed)/to unpick
newsletter/the news in brief/(Tw) SMS message
